thread.title: Manchester United set for £30 million Stefan de Vrij bid? Transfer news and gossip from Sunday's papers
thread.title_full: Manchester United set for £30 million Stefan de Vrij bid? Transfer news and gossip from Sunday's papers

author: Football Spy
title: Manchester United set for £30 million Stefan de Vrij bid? Transfer news and gossip from Sunday's papers
text:
Manchester United set for £30 million Stefan de Vrij bid? Transfer news and gossip from Sunday's papers PLUS: Pep Guardiola is planning a Monaco raid and Barcelona could stop Arsenal signing Max Allegri Share Lazio's £30 million-rated Dutch defender Stefan de Vrij could be Manchester United bound (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Lazio are prepared to sell their £30 million Dutch international Stefan De Vrij to Manchester United this summer. 
The Italian club have resigned themselves to losing the talented defender, who is out of contract at the end of next season and shows no interest in extending his stay. 
Jose Mourinho is a long-term admirer of the 25-year-old, according to the Express . 
De Vrij was a member of the 2014 World Cup Team of the Tournament after impressing for the Netherlands. 
Chelsea are also interested in the Dutchman, but he has told Lazio that he would like to move to Old Trafford instead. Stories from other newspapers and websites Kylian Mbappe is reportedly one of four Monaco players on Pep Guardiola's radar after their Champions League meeting (Photo: Getty Images) 
Manchester City's 5-3 Champions League win against Monaco convinced Pep Guardiola to sign off on a £120 million raid for four players - Kylian Mbappe, Benjamin Mendy, Fabinho and Thomas Lemar (Daily Star). 
Arsenal's plans to sign Juventus boss Masimilliano Allegri as their next manager could be hijacked by Barcelona, who are keen on the Italian (Express). 
Manchester United will battle Chelsea for Celtic superprospect Moussa Dembele as they look at life after Wayne Rooney (Daily Star). 
Roma have identified Chelsea centre-back Kurt Zouma as a target, with the French international yet to convince Antonio Conte since returning from a long lay-off (Express). 
Yaya Toure has refused to guarantee that he'll be at Manchester City club next season after coming in from the cold (Mail). Liverpool are said to be in the lead to sign Fulham's teen sensation Ryan Sessegnon (Photo: Reuters) 
Liverpool are set to win the race to sign Fulham wonderkid Ryan Sessegnon, who is also wanted by Chelsea, Arsenal and Manchester City (Express). 
Arsenal are ready to take the gloves off in their bid to sign Manchester City's teen sensation Jadon Sancho (Sun). 
Three Chinese clubs were close to signing Andy Carroll this month, with West Ham chief David Sullivan keen to cash in (Express). 
Sean Dyche is chasing Mainz defender Giulio Donati after expanding his scouting network to the Bundesliga (Mail). 
Mauricio Pochettino has vowed to bring in reinforcements after Tottenham's latest European setback (Express). Stories from the Sunday Mirror 
Manchester United are in pole position to sign AC Milan's £40 million-rated goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma , but are likely to face stiff competition from their local rivals for his signature. 
Chelsea are confident of beating AC Milan to the signing of Villarreal's £21 million-rated centre back Mateo Musacchio, despite advanced talks for the player to move to Italy in the summer. Villarreal's Mateo Musacchio is a wanted man in West London (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
Ronald Koeman is bullish that he will be able to bring Michael Keane - who scored to ensure a point for Burnley in Satiurday's game against Hull - to Goodison Park before next season. 
Rafa Benitez is the latest name to be linked with a switch to the Chinese Super League, with two separate teams willing to make the Spaniard the world's highest paid manager on a £600-a-week salary . poll loading Will Manchester United sign Stefan De Vrij 0+ VOTES SO FAR
